rev.comment: =Anarchy= : Clarify that anarchists ''don't'' believe Â«despotism <-> anarchyÂ».

Most anarchists you talk to will tell you a parent might sometimes be coercive with their children; Coercion with reasonable justification is fine, as it would then be a positive thing.
[[Egalitarianism]] is a present, but lesser subject of debate.

OK, I've done what I can with what's in the article. I think that a whole lot of stuff that's currently in other articles needs to be moved into this article.
First part of article heavily edited and reorganized. I'll get to the latter half in a bit, but I wanted to save the edit before it got much more substantial.

rm mention of egalitarianism from the 1st sentance

intro = include social movements, remove definition for "anarchy"
rework intro to include common definition of anarchy
refer to a theoretically desirable stateless society, saying it is desirable is POV
anarchists intend anarchy to refer to a desirable stateless society
rather, it intends "[[anarchy]]" to refer to a stateless society said to be different from a chaotic political situation.
theoretically desirable stateless society said to be different from a chaotic political situation
[anarchists intend] "[[anarchy]]" to refer to a desirable stateless society rather than a chaotic political situation.

imp. distinction"The [[anarchy]] sought by these philosophical anarchists is said not to be [[chaos]] or [[anomie]]

There were a handful of propaganda by the deed events amongs tens of thousands of anarchists, thus it was not a popular tactic. Two sentences moved to talk page.
The anarchy sought by phil anarchists is not merely "said" not to be anomie. Those who disown ac are not necessarily soc or com. Anarchism doesn't entail a "theoretical" absence of coercion
change sentence: "anarchist thought does not advocate for [[chaos]] or [[anomie]], and has a very different interpretation of [[anarchy]] than the popular definition." ?
"premiss" is the spelling Russell used, we might as well keep the quote exact :) check the dictionary, it is a valid alternative spelling!

adding citation, altering sentance, changing header

this article is much improved from what I've read so far!

see Talk on the functioning anarchies
commodified NOT commoditized. Also added information that online anarchist movements are anti-commodity and pro-use-value. (Even the pro-capitalist movements are anti-commodity, weird eh?)
